^0.8.20;\n\nimport \"./OnePToken.sol\";\nimport \"./OnePProtocol.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/utils/structs/EnumerableSet.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title OneP\n * @dev Child contract that inherits from OnePToken and implements the 1P Protocol\n * @notice This contract adds quantum-resistant authentication functionality to the base token\n *\n * Architecture:\n * - Inherits from OnePToken for ERC20 functionality and token economics\n * - Uses OnePProtocol library for authentication logic\n * - Maintains separation of concerns: token logic in parent, protocol logic here\n */\ncontract OneP is OnePToken {\n    using EnumerableSet for EnumerableSet.Bytes32Set;\n\n    // Protocol State\n    mapping(string => OnePProtocol.UserProfile) public usernameRegistry;\n    mapping(string => OnePProtocol.UserState) public userStateRegistry;\n    mapping(uint64 => OnePProtocol.Attempt) public attemptRegistry;\n\n    EnumerableSet.Bytes32Set private allUsernames;\n    string[] public allUsernamesArray;\n    uint64 public nextAttemptId;\n    address public verifier; // Backend verifier address\n\n    // Events\n    event UsernameRegistered(string onePUser, string name, string img);\n    event AccountAttached(string onePUser, address account);\n    event AttemptCreated(\n        uint64 id,\n        string onePUser,\n        address hotWallet,\n        uint64 difficulty\n    );\n    event AttemptUpdated(uint64 id, OnePProtocol.Status newStatus);\n\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initialize the OneP contract\n     * @param _verifier Address of the backend verifier\n     */\n    function initialize(address _verifier) public initializer {\n        uint256 _initialSupply = 10_000_000 ether; //10M $1P tokens\n\n        uint256 _cap = 100_000_000 ether; //100M $1P tokens\n        super.initializeToken(_initialSupply, _cap); // Initialize the parent OnePToken contract\n\n        // Set verifier\n        verifier = _verifier;\n    }\n\n    // ============ TOKEN ECONOMICS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate attempt fee based on user's difficulty level using mathematical bonding curve\n     * @param onePUser Username to get difficulty for\n     * @return attemptFee Fee for the attempt based on difficulty\n     */\n    function getAttemptFee(\n        string memory onePUser\n    ) public view returns (uint256 attemptFee) {\n        OnePProtocol.UserState memory state = userStateRegistry[onePUser];\n        uint64 difficulty = state.d == 0 ? 1 : state.d; // Default to difficulty 1 if not set\n\n        // Mathematical bonding curve: exponential growth with controlled bounds\n        // Formula: minFee + (maxFee - minFee) * (difficulty^2.5) / (MAX_ROUNDS^2.5)\n        // This creates a curve that starts slow and accelerates\n\n        uint256 minFee = OnePProtocol.MIN_ATTEMPT_FEE; // 0.01 ETH\n        uint256 maxFee = OnePProtocol.MAX_ATTEMPT_FEE; // 1 ETH\n        uint256 maxRounds = OnePProtocol.MAX_ROUNDS; // 10\n\n        // Calculate the curve: difficulty^2.5 / maxRounds^2.5\n        // Using fixed-point arithmetic to avoid floating point\n        uint256 difficultyScaled = uint256(difficulty) * uint256(difficulty);\n        difficultyScaled = difficultyScaled * uint256(difficulty); // difficulty^3\n        difficultyScaled = difficultyScaled / 2; // Approximate difficulty^2.5\n\n        uint256 maxRoundsScaled = maxRounds * maxRounds;\n        maxRoundsScaled = maxRoundsScaled * maxRounds; // maxRounds^3\n        maxRoundsScaled = maxRoundsScaled / 2; // Approximate maxRounds^2.5\n\n        uint256 decimals = this.decimals();\n        // Calculate fee using the curve\n        uint256 feeRange = maxFee - minFee;\n        uint256 curveMultiplier = (difficultyScaled * decimals) /\n            maxRoundsScaled;\n        uint256 additionalFee = (feeRange * curveMultiplier) / decimals;\n\n        uint256 calculatedFee = minFee + additionalFee;\n\n        // Ensure we stay within bounds\n        if (calculatedFee > maxFee) {\n            return maxFee;\n        } else if (calculatedFee < minFee) {\n            return minFee;\n        } else {\n            return calculatedFee;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ============ 1P PROTOCOL FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Register a new username (Step 1 of 1P Protocol)\n     * @param onePUser Username to register (e.g., \"alice.1p\")\n     * @param name Display name for the user\n     * @param img Profile image URL\n     */\n    function register(\n        string memory onePUser,\n        string memory name,\n        string memory img\n    ) external nonReentrant {\n        require(OnePProtocol.validateUsername(onePUser), \"Invalid username\");\n\n        require(\n            allUsernames.add(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(onePUser))),\n            \"Username exists\"\n        );\n\n        // Transfer registration fee to contract\n        _transfer(msg.sender, address(this), OnePProtocol.REGISTRATION_FEE);\n\n        // Create user profile\n        OnePProtocol.UserProfile memory profile = OnePProtocol.UserProfile({\n            name: name,\n            img: img,\n            account: address(0)\n        });\n\n        usernameRegistry[onePUser] = profile;\n        allUsernamesArray.push(onePUser);\n\n        emit UsernameRegistered(onePUser, name, img);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Attach custodial account to username (Step 2 of 1P Protocol)\n     * @param onePUser Username to attach account to\n     * @param account Custodial wallet address\n     */\n    function attachAccount(\n        string memory onePUser,\n        address account\n    ) external onlyVerifier {\n        OnePProtocol.UserProfile storage profile = usernameRegistry[onePUser];\n        require(bytes(profile.name).length > 0, \"Username not registered\");\n        require(profile.account == address(0), \"Account already set\");\n        require(OnePProtocol.validateAccount(account), \"Invalid account\");\n\n        profile.account = account;\n        emit AccountAttached(onePUser, account);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Request authentication attempt (Step 3 of 1P Protocol)\n     * @param onePUser Username requesting authentication\n     */\n    function requestAttempt(string memory onePUser) external nonReentrant {\n        require(this.usernameExists(onePUser), \"Username not registered\");\n\n        OnePProtocol.UserProfile storage profile = usernameRegistry[onePUser];\n\n        address onePAccount = profile.account;\n\n        if (onePAccount == address(0)) {\n            // fallback: to the platform\n            onePAccount = address(this);\n        }\n\n        uint256 currentFee = getAttemptFee(onePUser);\n        (\n            uint256 userShare,\n            uint256 verifierShare,\n            uint256 platformShare\n        ) = OnePProtocol.calculateFeeSplits(currentFee);\n\n        _transfer(msg.sender, address(this), platformShare);\n        _transfer(msg.sender, onePAccount, userShare);\n        _transfer(msg.sender, verifier, verifierShare);\n\n        _burn(address(this), platformShare); // Burn the platform share\n\n        // Update user state\n        OnePProtocol.UserState storage state = userStateRegistry[onePUser];\n        if (state.d == 0) {\n            state.d = 1;\n        }\n\n        state.totalAttempts++;\n        uint64 d = state.d;\n\n        // Create attempt using library\n        uint64 attemptId = nextAttemptId++;\n        OnePProtocol.Attempt memory attempt = OnePProtocol.createAttempt(\n            attemptId,\n            onePUser,\n            msg.sender,\n            d,\n            OnePProtocol.ATTEMPT_EXPIRY_DURATION // 10 minutes expiry\n        );\n\n        attemptRegistry[attemptId] = attempt;\n        emit AttemptCreated(attemptId, onePUser, msg.sender, d);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Update attempt status with progressive validation (only verifier)\n     * @param attemptId ID of the attempt to update\n     * @param newStatus New status (must be greater than current status)\n     */\n    function updateAttemptStatus(\n        uint64 attemptId,\n        OnePProtocol.Status newStatus\n    ) external onlyVerifier {\n        OnePProtocol.Attempt storage att = attemptRegistry[attemptId];\n\n        // Validate status transition is progressive\n        require(\n            OnePProtocol.isStatusProgressive(att.status, newStatus),\n            \"Status must be progressive\"\n        );\n\n        // Validate specific status transitions\n        require(\n            OnePProtocol.validateStatusTransition(att.status, newStatus),\n            \"Invalid status transition\"\n        );\n\n        require(!OnePProtocol.isAttemptExpired(att), \"Attempt expired\");\n\n        // Update status\n        att.status = newStatus;\n        emit AttemptUpdated(attemptId, newStatus);\n\n        // Only update user state for final statuses (Success or Failed)\n        if (\n            newStatus == OnePProtocol.Status.Success ||\n            newStatus == OnePProtocol.Status.Failed\n        ) {\n            OnePProtocol.UserState storage state = userStateRegistry[\n                att.onePUser\n            ];\n            bool isSuccess = (newStatus == OnePProtocol.Status.Success);\n\n            // Update state based on attempt result\n            uint64 nowTs = uint64(block.timestamp);\n\n            if (isSuccess) {\n                state.successCount++;\n                // Reduce difficulty on success\n                state.d = state.d > 1 ? state.d - 1 : 1;\n            } else {\n                state.failureCount++;\n                if (state.firstFailureTs == 0) {\n                    state.firstFailureTs = nowTs;\n                }\n                state.lastFailureTs = nowTs;\n\n                // Check for high abuse mode\n                if (\n                    OnePProtocol.shouldEnterHighAbuse(\n                        state.failureCount,\n                        state.firstFailureTs,\n                        nowTs\n                    )\n                ) {\n                    state.highAbuse = true;\n                }\n\n                // Increase difficulty\n                state.d = OnePProtocol.calculateNewDifficulty(\n                    state.d,\n                    state.highAbuse,\n                    false\n                );\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ============ VIEW FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get all attempt IDs\n     */\n    function getAllAttemptIds() external view returns (uint64[] memory) {\n        uint64[] memory ids = new uint64[](nextAttemptId);\n        for (uint64 i = 0; i < nextAttemptId; i++) {\n            ids[i] = i;\n        }\n        return ids;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get all registered usernames\n     */\n    function getAllUsernames() external view returns (string[] memory) {\n        return allUsernamesArray;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if username exists\n     */\n    function usernameExists(\n        string memory onePUser\n    ) external view returns (bool) {\n        bytes32 usernameHash = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(onePUser));\n        return allUsernames.contains(usernameHash);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get user profile by username\n     */\n    function getUserProfile(\n        string memory onePUser\n    ) external view returns (OnePProtocol.UserProfile memory) {\n        return usernameRegistry[onePUser];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get user state by username\n     */\n    function getUserState(\n        string memory onePUser\n    ) external view returns (OnePProtocol.UserState memory) {\n        return userStateRegistry[onePUser];\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get attempt by ID\n     */\n    function getAttempt(\n        uint64 attemptId\n    ) external view returns (OnePProtocol.Attempt memory) {\n        return attemptRegistry[attemptId];\n    }\n\n    // ============ ADMIN FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Update verifier address (only owner)\n     */\n    function updateVerifier(address _verifier) external onlyOwner {\n        require(_verifier != address(0), \"Invalid verifier\");\n        verifier = _verifier;\n    }\n\n    // ============ MODIFIERS ============\n\n    modifier onlyVerifier() {\n        require(msg.sender == verifier, \"Only verifier\");\n        _;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x3a3beede22957352f219851e51a874ae5e093f78091ad95a46e6b12e102d1fac","license":"MIT"},"contracts/1p/OnePProtocol.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\n/**\n * @title OnePProtocol\n * @dev Library containing all 1P Protocol logic and data structures\n * @notice This library provides pure functions and structs for the 1P authentication protocol\n *\n * The 1P Protocol is a quantum-resistant, zero-knowledge authentication system that uses\n * a single UTF-8 character as the secret credential. It introduces a Solver-Verifier framework\n * where the secret is stored exclusively on the Verifier side.\n */\nlibrary OnePProtocol {\n    // ============ CONSTANTS ============\n\n    uint64 constant MAX_ROUNDS = 10;\n    uint256 constant REGISTRATION_FEE = 100 ether; // 100 $1P tokens for registration\n\n    uint64 constant ATTEMPT_EXPIRY_DURATION = 600; // 10 minutes\n\n    // Fee splitting percentages (basis points: 10000 = 100%)\n    uint256 constant ATTEMPT_FEE_USER_SHARE = 4000; // 40%\n    uint256 constant ATTEMPT_FEE_VERIFIER_SHARE = 4000; // 40%\n    uint256 constant ATTEMPT_FEE_PLATFORM_SHARE = 2000; // 20%\n\n    // Token Economics Constants\n    uint256 public constant MAX_ATTEMPT_FEE = 1 ether; // Maximum cost per attempt\n    uint256 public constant MIN_ATTEMPT_FEE = 0.01 ether; // Minimum cost per attempt\n\n    // ============ ENUMS ============\n\n    enum Status {\n        Pending,\n        InProgress,\n        Success,\n        Failed\n    }\n\n    // ============ STRUCTS ============\n\n    struct UserProfile {\n        string name;\n        string img; // URL\n        address account; // Custodial, set once by verifier\n    }\n\n    struct UserState {\n        uint64 totalAttempts;\n        uint64 successCount;\n        uint64 failureCount;\n        uint64 firstFailureTs;\n        uint64 lastFailureTs;\n        uint64 d; // difficulty\n        bool highAbuse;\n    }\n\n    struct Attempt {\n        uint64 id;\n        string onePUser;\n        address hotWallet;\n        uint64 expiresAt;\n        uint64 difficulty;\n        Status status;\n    }\n\n    // ============ EVENTS ============\n\n    event UsernameRegistered(string onePUser, string name, string img);\n    event AccountAttached(string onePUser, address account);\n    event AttemptCreated(\n        uint64 id,\n        string onePUser,\n        address hotWallet,\n        uint64 difficulty\n    );\n    event AttemptUpdated(uint64 id, Status newStatus);\n\n    // ============ VALIDATION FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Validate username format\n     * @param onePUser Username to validate\n     * @return isValid True if username is valid\n     */\n    function validateUsername(\n        string memory onePUser\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isValid) {\n        bytes memory usernameBytes = bytes(onePUser);\n        return usernameBytes.length > 0 && usernameBytes.length <= 64; // Max 64 chars\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Validate account address\n     * @param account Address to validate\n     * @return isValid True if address is valid\n     */\n    function validateAccount(\n        address account\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isValid) {\n        return account != address(0);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Validate attempt status transition\n     * @param currentStatus Current attempt status\n     * @param newStatus New attempt status\n     * @return isValid True if transition is valid\n     */\n    function validateStatusTransition(\n        Status currentStatus,\n        Status newStatus\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isValid) {\n        if (currentStatus == Status.Pending && newStatus == Status.InProgress) {\n            return true;\n        }\n        if (\n            currentStatus == Status.InProgress &&\n            (newStatus == Status.Success || newStatus == Status.Failed)\n        ) {\n            return true;\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if new status is greater than current status (progressive update)\n     * @param currentStatus Current attempt status\n     * @param newStatus New attempt status\n     * @return isProgressive True if new status is greater than current\n     */\n    function isStatusProgressive(\n        Status currentStatus,\n        Status newStatus\n    ) internal pure returns (bool isProgressive) {\n        return uint8(newStatus) > uint8(currentStatus);\n    }\n\n    // ============ DIFFICULTY CALCULATION ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate new difficulty based on attempt result\n     * @param currentDifficulty Current difficulty level\n     * @param isHighAbuse Whether user is in high abuse mode\n     * @param isSuccess Whether attempt was successful\n     * @return newDifficulty New difficulty level\n     */\n    function calculateNewDifficulty(\n        uint64 currentDifficulty,\n        bool isHighAbuse,\n        bool isSuccess\n    ) internal pure returns (uint64 newDifficulty) {\n        if (isSuccess) {\n            // On success, maintain or slightly reduce difficulty\n            return currentDifficulty > 1 ? currentDifficulty - 1 : 1;\n        } else {\n            // On failure, increase difficulty\n            if (isHighAbuse) {\n                return min(MAX_ROUNDS, currentDifficulty * 2);\n            } else {\n                return min(MAX_ROUNDS, currentDifficulty + 1);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if user should enter high abuse mode\n     * @param failureCount Number of failures\n     * @param firstFailureTs Timestamp of first failure\n     * @param currentTs Current timestamp\n     * @return shouldEnterHighAbuse True if should enter high abuse mode\n     */\n    function shouldEnterHighAbuse(\n        uint64 failureCount,\n        uint64 firstFailureTs,\n        uint64 currentTs\n    ) internal pure returns (bool) {\n        return\n            failureCount >= 3 &&\n            firstFailureTs > 0 &&\n            (currentTs - firstFailureTs) < 3600; // 1 hour\n    }\n\n    // ============ ATTEMPT MANAGEMENT ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Create a new attempt\n     * @param attemptId ID for the new attempt\n     * @param onePUser Username requesting attempt\n     * @param hotWallet Wallet address requesting attempt\n     * @param difficulty Current difficulty level\n     * @param expiryDuration Duration until attempt expires (in seconds)\n     * @return attempt New attempt struct\n     */\n    function createAttempt(\n        uint64 attemptId,\n        string memory onePUser,\n        address hotWallet,\n        uint64 difficulty,\n        uint64 expiryDuration\n    ) internal view returns (Attempt memory attempt) {\n        uint64 nowTs = uint64(block.timestamp);\n\n        return\n            Attempt({\n                id: attemptId,\n                onePUser: onePUser,\n                hotWallet: hotWallet,\n                expiresAt: nowTs + expiryDuration,\n                difficulty: difficulty,\n                status: Status.Pending\n            });\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Check if attempt is expired\n     * @param attempt Attempt to check\n     * @return isExpired True if attempt is expired\n     */\n    function isAttemptExpired(\n        Attempt memory attempt\n    ) internal view returns (bool isExpired) {\n        return block.timestamp >= attempt.expiresAt;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Update attempt status\n     * @param attempt Attempt to update\n     * @param newStatus New status\n     * @return updatedAttempt Updated attempt\n     */\n    function updateAttemptStatus(\n        Attempt memory attempt,\n        Status newStatus\n    ) internal pure returns (Attempt memory updatedAttempt) {\n        attempt.status = newStatus;\n        return attempt;\n    }\n\n    // ============ USER STATE MANAGEMENT ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initialize user state\n     * @return state Initialized user state\n     */\n    function initializeUserState()\n        internal\n        pure\n        returns (UserState memory state)\n    {\n        return\n            UserState({\n                totalAttempts: 0,\n                successCount: 0,\n                failureCount: 0,\n                firstFailureTs: 0,\n                lastFailureTs: 0,\n                d: 1, // Start with difficulty 1\n                highAbuse: false\n            });\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Update user state after attempt\n     * @param state Current user state\n     * @param isSuccess Whether attempt was successful\n     * @return updatedState Updated user state\n     */\n    function updateUserStateAfterAttempt(\n        UserState memory state,\n        bool isSuccess\n    ) internal view returns (UserState memory updatedState) {\n        state.totalAttempts++;\n        uint64 nowTs = uint64(block.timestamp);\n\n        if (isSuccess) {\n            state.successCount++;\n            // Reduce difficulty on success\n            state.d = state.d > 1 ? state.d - 1 : 1;\n        } else {\n            state.failureCount++;\n            if (state.firstFailureTs == 0) {\n                state.firstFailureTs = nowTs;\n            }\n            state.lastFailureTs = nowTs;\n\n            // Check for high abuse mode\n            if (\n                shouldEnterHighAbuse(\n                    state.failureCount,\n                    state.firstFailureTs,\n                    nowTs\n                )\n            ) {\n                state.highAbuse = true;\n            }\n\n            // Increase difficulty\n            state.d = calculateNewDifficulty(state.d, state.highAbuse, false);\n        }\n\n        return state;\n    }\n\n    // ============ FEE CALCULATION ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate dynamic attempt fee based on bonding curve\n     * @param baseFee Base fee for attempts\n     * @param feeMultiplier Multiplier for bonding curve\n     * @param totalSupply Current total token supply\n     * @param maxCost Maximum cost per attempt\n     * @param minCost Minimum cost per attempt\n     * @return fee Calculated attempt fee\n     */\n    function calculateAttemptFee(\n        uint256 baseFee,\n        uint256 feeMultiplier,\n        uint256 totalSupply,\n        uint256 maxCost,\n        uint256 minCost\n    ) internal pure returns (uint256 fee) {\n        uint256 calculatedFee = baseFee + (totalSupply / 1e18) * feeMultiplier;\n\n        if (calculatedFee > maxCost) {\n            return maxCost;\n        } else if (calculatedFee < minCost) {\n            return minCost;\n        } else {\n            return calculatedFee;\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ============ UTILITY FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get minimum of two uint64 values\n     * @param a First value\n     * @param b Second value\n     * @return result Minimum value\n     */\n    function min(uint64 a, uint64 b) internal pure returns (uint64 result) {\n        return a < b ? a : b;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Get maximum of two uint64 values\n     * @param a First value\n     * @param b Second value\n     * @return result Maximum value\n     */\n    function max(uint64 a, uint64 b) internal pure returns (uint64 result) {\n        return a > b ? a : b;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate rounds based on difficulty\n     * @param difficulty Difficulty level\n     * @return rounds Number of rounds\n     */\n    function calculateRounds(\n        uint64 difficulty\n    ) internal pure returns (uint64 rounds) {\n        return difficulty + (difficulty / 2); // r = d + floor(d/2)\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate fee splits with proper rounding handling\n     * @param totalFee Total fee to split\n     * @return userShare User's share of the fee\n     * @return verifierShare Verifier's share of the fee\n     * @return platformShare Platform's share of the fee\n     */\n    function calculateFeeSplits(\n        uint256 totalFee\n    )\n        internal\n        pure\n        returns (\n            uint256 userShare,\n            uint256 verifierShare,\n            uint256 platformShare\n        )\n    {\n        // Calculate shares using basis points to avoid rounding issues\n        userShare = (totalFee * ATTEMPT_FEE_USER_SHARE) / 10000;\n        verifierShare = (totalFee * ATTEMPT_FEE_VERIFIER_SHARE) / 10000;\n        platformShare = (totalFee * ATTEMPT_FEE_PLATFORM_SHARE) / 10000;\n\n        // Handle any remainder due to rounding by adding it to platform share\n        uint256 totalSplit = userShare + verifierShare + platformShare;\n        if (totalSplit < totalFee) {\n            platformShare += (totalFee - totalSplit);\n        }\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Calculate delay based on difficulty\n     * @param difficulty Difficulty level\n     * @return delay Delay in seconds\n     */\n    function calculateDelay(\n        uint64 difficulty\n    ) internal pure returns (uint64 delay) {\n        return min(60, difficulty); // Cap at 60 seconds\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xf0967c26a234f520214e9e6f34067477cc2cbd3dc53bd0d3eae3c93d7e697476","license":"MIT"},"contracts/1p/OnePToken.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\npragma solidity ^0.8.20;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20PermitUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20PausableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/security/ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20CappedUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC20BurnableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title OnePToken\n * @dev Parent contract containing all token economics and ERC20 functionality\n * @notice This contract provides the base token functionality that can be extended by child contracts\n *\n * Key Features:\n * - ERC20 token with upgradeable functionality\n * - Dynamic pricing based on bonding curves\n * - Owner-controlled minting and burning\n * - Pausable functionality\n * - Permit functionality for gasless approvals\n * - Fee management and token economics\n */\ncontract OnePToken is\n    Initializable,\n    ERC20PermitUpgradeable,\n    ERC20PausableUpgradeable,\n    ERC20CappedUpgradeable,\n    ERC20BurnableUpgradeable,\n    OwnableUpgradeable,\n    ReentrancyGuardUpgradeable,\n    UUPSUpgradeable\n{\n    /// @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Initialize the OnePToken contract\n     * @param _initialSupply Initial token supply to mint\n     * @param _cap Maximum token supply cap\n     */\n    function initializeToken(uint256 _initialSupply, uint256 _cap) public {\n        string memory name_ = \"1P\";\n        string memory symbol_ = \"1P\";\n\n        __ERC20_init(name_, symbol_);\n        __ERC20Permit_init(name_);\n        __ERC20Capped_init(_cap);\n        __Pausable_init();\n        __Ownable_init();\n        __ReentrancyGuard_init();\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\n\n        _mint(msg.sender, _initialSupply);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Authorize contract upgrades (only owner)\n     */\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(\n        address newImplementation\n    ) internal override onlyOwner {}\n\n    // ============ ADMIN FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Pause contract (only owner)\n     */\n    function pause() external onlyOwner {\n        _pause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Unpause contract (only owner)\n     */\n    function unpause() external onlyOwner {\n        _unpause();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Mint tokens (only owner)\n     */\n    function mint(address to, uint256 amount) external onlyOwner {\n        _mint(to, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Burn tokens from account (only owner)\n     * @param from Address to burn tokens from\n     * @param amount Amount of tokens to burn\n     */\n    function burn(address from, uint256 amount) external {\n        require(\n            msg.sender == from || msg.sender == owner(),\n            \"Only the owner of the token or the token holder can burn tokens\"\n        );\n        _burn(from, amount);\n    }\n\n    // ============ INTERNAL FUNCTIONS ============\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Override _mint to respect cap\n     */\n    function _mint(\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal override(ERC20Upgradeable, ERC20CappedUpgradeable) {\n        super._mint(to, amount);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Override _beforeTokenTransfer to handle all token transfers\n     */\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) internal override(ERC20Upgradeable, ERC20PausableUpgradeable) {\n        super._beforeTokenTransfer(from, to, amount);\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xa34243168421fe9b877766bcec103203f9ac4bd4fe18c9ddb8d6946074cf8f4b","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: Child contract that inherits from OnePToken and implements the 1P Protocol

AdminChanged(address,address).details: Emitted when the admin account has changed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

BeaconUpgraded(address).details: Emitted when the beacon is changed.

EIP712DomainChanged().details: MAY be emitted to signal that the domain could have changed.

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Paused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

Unpaused(address).details: Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`.

Upgraded(address).details: Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.

DOMAIN_SEPARATOR().details: Returns the domain separator used in the encoding of the signature for {permit}, as defined by {EIP712}.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

attachAccount(string,address).details: Attach custodial account to username (Step 2 of 1P Protocol)

burn(uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from the caller. See {ERC20-_burn}.

burnFrom(address,uint256).details: Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, deducting from the caller's allowance. See {ERC20-_burn} and {ERC20-allowance}. Requirements: - the caller must have allowance for ``accounts``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

cap().details: Returns the cap on the token's total supply.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getAttemptFee(string).details: Calculate attempt fee based on user's difficulty level using mathematical bonding curve

returns.attemptFee: Fee for the attempt based on difficulty

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

nonces(address).details: Returns the current nonce for `owner`. This value must be included whenever a signature is generated for {permit}. Every successful call to {permit} increases ``owner``'s nonce by one. This prevents a signature from being used multiple times.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

permit(address,address,uint256,uint256,u.details: Sets `value` as the allowance of `spender` over ``owner``'s tokens, given ``owner``'s signed approval. IMPORTANT: The same issues {IERC20-approve} has related to transaction ordering also apply here. Emits an {Approval} event. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `deadline` must be a timestamp in the future. - `v`, `r` and `s` must be a valid `secp256k1` signature from `owner` over the EIP712-formatted function arguments. - the signature must use ``owner``'s current nonce (see {nonces}). For more information on the signature format, see the https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612#specification[relevant EIP section]. CAUTION: See Security Considerations above.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

register(string,string,string).details: Register a new username (Step 1 of 1P Protocol)

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `amount`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `amount`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `amount`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateAttemptStatus(uint64,uint8).details: Update attempt status with progressive validation (only verifier)

params.attemptId: ID of the attempt to update
params.newStatus: New status (must be greater than current status)

upgradeTo(address).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

devdoc.title: OneP

userdoc.notice: This contract adds quantum-resistant authentication functionality to the base token Architecture: - Inherits from OnePToken for ERC20 functionality and token economics - Uses OnePProtocol library for authentication logic - Maintains separation of concerns: token logic in parent, protocol logic here
